attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Stop the  plans, to use the hard shoulder on motorways, as an additional lane.
attributes.background: The plans to use the hard shoulder, on motorways, as an additional lane, is ill conceived and very dangerous. The hard shoulder is an EMERGENCY lane and should be kept as such. The emergency  and breakdown services will not be able to help drivers in the event of an accident or breakdown.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the emergency/breakdown services and motoring organisations, have already expressed their concern.

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Abolish the wasteful Brexit (Exiting the EU) and International Trade Departments
attributes.background: These departments replicate functions of the existing Foreign and Cabinet Offices and Business Department. They're wasteful and disruptive, serving no useful function. Britain's governing party and its squabbling ministers should settle their differences over Europe internally not at public expense.
attributes.additional_details:
https://twitter.com/lewiscoughlan/status/764377677038030848

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hiring-brexit-experts-will-cost-billions-khn6mw3j2

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/13/liam-fox-and-boris-johnson-locked-in-feud-over-who-controls-brit/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3749965/ANDREW-PIERCE-longer-Theresa-tolerate-three-backstabbing-Brexiteers.html

attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Allow alternative advanced chemotherapy treatment in the UK
attributes.background: We have a very close friend who is terminally ill with cancer. Our dear friend Brigitta, who is a mother of 2 children, Marco and Denym and loving wife to Massi has fought this dreadful disease for 13 years and endured various forms of treatment. She is now in need of advanced specialist treatment
attributes.additional_details:
To enable Brigitta to live her life and feel slightly more normal again, we are having to raise £30,000 to send her overseas for specialist medical treatment which could really make a difference to her health and current situation. 
If this was to be available in the UK to Brigitta, then her family would not have the concerns they do about funds and could have this advanced treatment without having to rely so much on other peoples help. 
We are currently organising events and fundraising pages to help Brigitta through her journey, and hope we reach this goal to get her this treatment that she deserves.
Please help and support this worthy cause, and get this treatment into the UK!

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message

attributes.action: Arm all police officers with firearms, to deter and limit impact of terrorism.
attributes.background: The ability to rapidly deal with armed terrorists cannot be met by specialist units alone. Having a rapid, local, armed response is crucial to limiting the damage terrorists can do. This can only be achieved by arming all police officers.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: NOT to allow Bailiffs to enter property unless accompanied by a police officer
attributes.background: Many people today experience violent and aggressive bailiffs. To avoid assault and humiliating threats, a police officer should attend entry to any property avoiding potential physical harm to the house holder and others to remove all threats of violence or intimidation.
attributes.additional_details: That the bailiff focus on the collection procedure showing respect and non violent means using reasonable behaviour at all times.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords if it delays Brexit.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum was held in July 2006 to decide whether the UK should leave the EU or remain a member state. The majority of the people of the United Kingdom voted  to Leave the EU.  An Act of Parliament is required for the Government to meet its pledge to invoke Article 50 by 31st March 2017.
attributes.additional_details: A significant number of Members of the House of Lords have stated they oppose Brexit. Should the House of Lords in any way delay legislation so as to prevent the Government meeting the 31st March 2017 deadline it will have shown it despises the will of the people and the democratic process. Should it do so then the House of Lords must be abolished as it will have demonstrated that it and its unelected members have neither place nor purpose in a modern democracy.

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ensure all vehicles have a dash cam installed.
attributes.background:
This will serve as a very good form of evidence, in cases of poor driving on our roads, including undertaking at speed, use of cellphones whilst driving, road rage incidents, drink driving.
I have had several cases of experiencing drivers using cellphones whilst in control of their vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: I have been able to provide, evidence of anti social behaviour to the Police who have been able to take further action deemed necessary.

attributes.action: Change law to require LA's to provide 15 min free parking in all LA parking bays
attributes.background: Often drivers feel they have received a parking ticket for staying only a few seconds over their designated period. There a distrust between drivers and local authorities, drivers believing that they are being penalised by Councils raising parking fees to cover other council spending.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013 LAs made £635 million surplus from parking revenue.

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland
attributes.background:
PM Theresa May will be entering into Brexit negotiations with Nicola Sturgeon hanging around her leg like an anchor.
The time has come for the UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland.
attributes.additional_details:
The overwhelming success of the SNP in the 2015 General election.
The ratio of Scottish votes to remain in the EU
The volume of hate and vitriol from our neighbours  in the north
William Wallace
The battle of Bannockburn https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Bannockburn

attributes.action: Stop new Child Maintenence Service going by Gross income instead of Net income.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service is now going by gross income instead of fathers actual net pay.
attributes.additional_details: How can the new Child Maintenance Service justify going by gross income instead of net income? How can us fathers pay for our children with money that we do not even receive? I'm all for paying for our children but adding 20% charges on top if you use the collect and pay Service? Not all families have the luxury of their child's mother being co operative and will force you to use CMS. They don't even consider your monthly expenses such as mortgage etc. Please help and get the government to stop this ridiculous change before we all end up homeless and jobless.

attributes.action: Make all injunctions free for those who are victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
My mum had been a victim of domestic violence for 20 years. A painful journey it had been. After finding the courage to leave she looked into implementing an injunction which was charged at £130 for each year. 
Victims are being left with an impossible choice save themselves or pay for the letter.
attributes.additional_details:
Injunction - An injunction is an equitable remedy in the form of a court order that compels a party to do or refrain from specific acts. A party that fails to comply with an injunction faces criminal or civil penalties, including possible monetary sanctions and even imprisonment. They can also be charged with contempt of court 

Wikipedia (2016) 'Injunction' available from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injunction

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Make compulsory the labeling of Eggs from Caged Hens on all food products.
attributes.background: Many consumers are grateful for the opportunity to choose between purchasing free range eggs or those from caged hens. It is troubling, however, that most food products which contain egg don't specify if the eggs used are from Caged hens. This prevents consumers making an informed, ethical choice.

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: Make car insurance more affordable for all persons who have never made a claim.
attributes.background: I never knew some years ago that my no claims bonus would expire after two years, as a result of this obtaining affordable car insurance is now near impossible! I have purchased a used car for £500 and my insurance quotes are well over £1000 with a deposit equivalent to my households weekly income!
attributes.additional_details: I think that all persons should have a "claims background record" that would be similar to credit history wear all past claims and no claims are noted. I have been driving for 15 years and have never made a claim in my life! How is it fair that I or anybody else should be penalised for not having any proof of no claims. I have had to take out temporary cover costing me £75 for 7 days until I figure out what I can do! If I took the insurance on offer simply paying the deposit would mean my children and myself would starve, no bills would get paid and we would also be without gas and electric, and that is the reality of the situation and it simply needs to change.

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.
